category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.

result.title: Edge and cloud infrastructure resource and computational continuum orchestration system (final)
result.description: This deliverable will report on the outcomes of the WP by fully describing the end-to-end orchestration and resource management system. An initial version of the deliverable will be released at M21 (D2.1), showing first release of the end-to-end orchestration platform, an initial network slicing management system, the first security and privacy mechanisms for the CHARITY framework and a first iteration of the unified OSS application management. The final version (complete end-to-end orchestration system) will be released at M40 (D2.2).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.

result.title: Outline of an easy-to-implement screening strategy ready for im-plementation base on outcomes including risk factors and monitoring method
result.description: Based on results of Task 1.1 multiple health determinants available across studies will be assessed for their potential to identify subgroups with higher screening yield, more effective relative/absolute stroke/SE risk reduction and lowest bleeding risk under OAC. Task 1.5 will primarily focus on varia-bles comprised in the CHA2DS2-VASc (congestive heart failure, hypertension, age 65/75 years, prior stroke, history of vascular disease and sex) score due to consistent availability. Patient-level data will be analysed locally following centrally established protocols with MAC working together with all partners with study data. Where possible, de-identified information will be used for training and validation of multi-parameter regression and machine learning modelling (UKE, Task 2.6) to select predictors of AF risk and subsequent development of stroke/SE and/or bleeding. Task 1.5 will examine sex differences in AF screening yield, stroke/SE and risk of stroke and adverse events, but also sex differences in risk induced by OAC therapy following positive screening for AF.Besides the CHA2DS2-VASc variables, the natriuretic peptide N-terminal pro B-type natriuretic peptide (Nt-proBNP) 125ng/L will be used to select individuals from the community for prolonged, intermittent screening. AFFECT-EU will evaluate this pragmatic screening approach for its ability to reduce the number needed to screen and its accuracy. The consortium will collect and measure Nt-proBNP (central lab or point of care depending on the local study requirements) in cooperation with industry (Roche Diagnostics) for prospective validation and further optimization in independent stud-ies in >150,000 screenees.Nt-proBNP will be measured in stored blood samples (Table 1.1.) (assays provided by Roche Diagnostics as in-kind contribution), newly drawn samples during the grant period or by point-of-care testing (test kits and machines provided by Roche Diagnostics as in-kind contribu-tion) in studies without laboratory facilities. For central measurements, studies will ship samples to the biomarker laboratory in Hamburg. Local measurement is possible if sample transfer is not permitted by consent/data protection. WP1 will proof the clinical value of AF screening by an objective and clinically significant reduction in adverse outcomes. Integrating all results and considering the diverse aspects elucidated in WP1, a robust, easy-to-implement screening strategy will be proposed.
